title: Paleo Shrimp Zoodle Scampi
description: Bright, garlicky shrimp tossed with tender zucchini noodles in a lemon-butter (olive oil) scampi-style sauce. Fast, low-carb weeknight dinner with fresh herbs and a silky sauce that clings to each zoodle.

ingredients.display_name: raw large shrimp, peeled and deveined (16-20 count) tails removed
ingredients.notes: pat dry; if frozen, thaw completely and pat dry
medium zucchini each ~160-170g; drain excess liquid if needed
used to loosen sauce if needed

steps.text: Prepare ingredients: spiralize zucchini into zoodles, pat shrimp dry, mince garlic and shallot, chop parsley, and juice and zest lemon.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and add two tablespoons olive oil. When shimmering, add shrimp in a single layer and season lightly with half the salt and pepper; cook until pink and opaque, about 1.5-2 minutes per side depending on size. Transfer shrimp to a plate and tent to keep warm.
Reduce heat to medium and add remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil plus the ghee to the skillet. Add the minced shallot and cook, stirring, until softened and fragrant, about 1-2 minutes.
Add minced garlic and optional red pepper flakes; saut√©, stirring constantly so garlic doesn't burn, until fragrant about 30 seconds to 1 minute.
Deglaze the pan with lemon juice and the water or seafood stock, scraping brown bits from the bottom; let the liquid reduce slightly for about 1-2 minutes to concentrate flavor.
Return the cooked shrimp to the skillet and toss to coat in the sauce; add chopped parsley and lemon zest if using. Cook together briefly to heat through, about 1 minute.

Push shrimp to the side, add zoodles to the pan and toss with the sauce for 1.5-2 minutes until just tender but still al dente; season to taste with remaining salt and pepper. If sauce seems dry, add a splash of water and toss once more.
Plate immediately, garnish with remaining chopped parsley and an extra squeeze of lemon; serve hot.
